item.title: Analysis of Open Datasets
item.description: What OpenDC can do OpenDC can help you find among the thousands of webpages the open data sets that can help your organisation unlock new insights. Some of this data will be too big to be analysed by usual tools like Excel. OpenDC can help you load and analyse this data using open source programming tools such as Python libraries or PostgreSQL databases. Once this data is identified and loaded, OpenDC can help you analyse the patterns in the data, cross the information with external independent datasets to find correlations, answer the questions you have asked and perhaps the ones you have not.

item.title: SENSE Pedestrian Assignment Software
item.description: Company: Movement Strategies Ltd Client: Internal project -- Sector: Pedestrian modelling What we did: We developed a pedestrian dynamic assignment software, with an assignment algorithm based on fluid mechanics principles. The tool can assign an unlimited number of pedestrians, at any scale and custom flow density relationship can be implemented. How we use open data or software: The tool was computed as a QGIS plugin, open source software providing an open source API.

item.title: Life territories within the "Grand Paris"
item.description: Company: CDVIA Client: Agence D&A Sector: Urban planning What we did: We created a tool analysing commuting data from the French National Institute of Statistics (INSEE) to help our client understand how commuting data can give insights on how neighbouring cities bound together and define perimeters that can sometimes be at odds with the official administration boundaries. How we use open data or software: We used French national ordnance survey data from INSEE before it was called open data.

item.title: QGIS Plugin Development
item.description: What OpenDC can do OpenDC can develop for you custom QGIS plugins under the QGIS API. Note that any QGIS plugin that is publicly released has to be open-source. You can however use your plugin internally if you do not want to release the code. How this service can help your organisation You might be interested in a custom QGIS plugin if you are working for a Non Governmental Organisation (NGO) with interesting geographical datasets that you want to make available to the GIS community in order to enable the wide analysis of this data set.

item.title: Transportation Mode Choice Estimator
item.description: Company: CDVIA Client: Internal project -- Sector: Transport modelling What we did: We helped our client build a public transport assignment tool plugged into their in-house private transport assignment tool. We then collected open data of observed mode choice for commute at an aggregate level. Using private and public transportation travel times derived from the assignment tools, we have inferred a simple model giving a mode probability as a function of the difference of travel time between public and private transportation options.

item.title: Project EDMOND
item.description: Company: Telefónica UK Client: Transport for London (TfL) Sector: Data analytics in transport What we did: The TfL EDMOND (Estimating Demand from MObile Network Data) project aimed to build Origin-Destination (OD) matrices in the Greater London Authority (GLA) using mobile network data fused with external datasets. As part of the Telefónica UK team in a joint project involving two major consultancies (Jacobs and AECOM), we managed the team of Telefónica analysts in charge of collecting, cleaning, filtering, scaling and analysing the mobile network data.

item.title: Assistance on mobility studies
item.description: What OpenDC can do OpenDC’s founder has over 10 years experience in transport and pedestrian modelling projects, working in London, Paris and Guinea Conakry. OpenDC can help strengthen your team on high profile mobility projects with advanced modelling and project management skills. How this service can help your organisation OpenDC can help you in your mobility project if you are working for a Local council and want to be advised on a mobility study you would like to launch.

item.title: Advice on the use of mobile phone and GPS data
item.description: What OpenDC can do OpenDC’s founder has developed an expertise in the use of mobile phone data (GSM) and GPS data to understand people movement. This expertise involves the data collection, storage, cleansing, filtering processes using different mathematical tools, scaling, bias correction, aggregation, analysis and visualisation. item.title: Open Data Consultants
item.description: OpenDC has been founded in 2019 by Daniel Marin, engineer from ENSTA ParisTech (France) and INSTN CEA Saclay. Daniel has over 10 years experience in mathematical modelling for transportation, mobility and pedestrian studies and data analysis. Currently, OpenDC is a one-person company providing contracting work for consultancies and public bodies. However, OpenDC has a network of larger companies specialized in pedestrian and transport modelling and ready to partner if a project requires large teams.
